Actually, yes, we'll probably write one very soon on my current project
to serve as a functional tester for our message based application. I
just cannot believe nobody has ever written and posted one !

-Vincent

P.S.: I'm copying James Strachan, he might have one ... :-)

> Scott Stirling
> Macromedia
> 
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Vincent Massol
> 
> Hi,
> 
> I was wondering if someone had already written a JMSTestCase that
would
> help in testing a JMS system, like a message-driven application ?
> 
> The JMSTestCase would provide helper methods to send and receive JMS
> messages. It could also override the runBare() method and
automatically
> execute a setUpJms() method before calling setUp() (and the same for
> teardown()). Properties like name of queues/topics/JNDI info could be
> externalized to a properties file and/or as Java system properties.
> 
> Anyone ?
> 
> Thanks
> -Vincent
